result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan J Hase was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: J/S payment of restitution to Limericks in the amount of $2400, and $1455 to the City of Wausau.
Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two.
No contact with any of the victims(specific areas), unless approved by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 

DNA sample. 

Court finds defendant may be eligible for expungment at the age of 21, as long as conditions are completed and no other violations occur.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan J Hase

records.addlTxt: Corrected to mark J&S box for restitution

Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases called at 9:32 am. 
INCLUDES: 21CT327 & 22CM4. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears, pro se. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to: 
21CT327 --
Ct.1(Operate w/o Valid License (3rd+ w/in 3 years))>>DRI.

22CM4 --
Ct.4(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct.5(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct.6(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct.7(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
22CM4 --
Ct.1(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>GUILTY. 
Ct.2(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>GUILTY.
Ct.3(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two.  No contact with any of the victims(specific areas), unless approved by agent.  J/S payment of restitution to Limericks in the amount of $2400, and $1455 to the City of Wausau.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

Court finds defendant may be eligible for expungment at the age of 21, as long as conditions are completed and no other violations occur. 
Adj: 9:41 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea hearing on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 10, 2022 at 10:10 am.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases Called at 9:04 am.
INCLUDES: 22CM4 & 21CT327.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Deft appears, pro se.
VRCW. 

Deft states he is unsure if he will be represented. 
Court recommends contact SPD if he wishes to be represented.
State has extended an offer and has not heard back. Deft is going to seek counsel; 
Court is leaving trial date on. 

NEXT DATE:
STC set for 5/10 at 10:10 am. 
Adj: 9:09 am.
Victim impact statement- Limerick's Public House

Pre-trial conference on January 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury Trial on May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

INCLUDES 22CM04 and 21CT327:  No contact with victim(s): S.J.J., D.L.T., D.L.J., Amaximo Realistate Agency, Jefferson Street Parking Ramp, Community Corner Clubhouse, Limericks.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.

Clerk: Amanda.
Cases called at 2:46 pm.
INCLUDES: 22CM4 & 21CT327. 

State appears by ADA Cody Marschall. Defendant appears, pro se.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY. 

COURT ORDERS: $1,000 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): S.J.J., D.L.T., D.L.J., Amaximo Realistate Agency, Jefferson Street Parking Ramp, Community Corner Clubhouse, Limericks. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- No driving without a valid license.
